p: Zika is an infectious disease, spread mainly by Aedes mosquitoes ( World Health Organization, 2016). The same species of mosquitoes that transmits Zika also spreads dengue and chikungunya ( World Health Organization, 2016). Although Zika, dengue, and chikungunya share similar initial symptoms, they have different complications ( World Health Organization, 2016). The Zika outbreak has been linked to microcephaly and other birth complications and Guillain-Barre syndrome in older individuals ( World Health Organization, 2016).
